title: What happens when you don't assign?
content: We just learned about variables and how we can store values in them for later use, but what happens when you don't assign a value when creating a variable?

title: No value assigned
content: When we learn how to create variables, we always had a value assigned to it. You can also just create variables with no values assigned to it. In the code below myFirstVariable is assigned to a default value called undefined. This always happens when any variable is created and doesn't have anything assigned to it.

title: undefined
content: Undefined is also its own unique type and value. Meaning you can create variables and explicitly set the value to be undefined. So the following three variables below are assigned the same value.
code:
let myFirstVariable

const mySecondVariable

let myThirdVariable = undefined

answers.explanation: Remember you can't reassign the value of any variable declared using const, so myNumber will always have the value undefined
Remember you can reassign the value of any variable declared using let
